title: Store-Bought Solutions to All Our Ills
text: For as long as there have been powerful companies there have been novels assailing their authoritarian tendencies, from Frank Norris’s muckraking exposé of railroad trusts in “The Octopus” to Aldous Huxley’s dystopian satire on Henry Ford’s mass-production innovations in “Brave New World” to Dave Eggers’s dark vision of an all-seeing Silicon Valley tech colossus in “The Circle.” The latest corporate cautionary tale is Rob Hart’s “The Warehouse” (Crown, 358 pages, $27), about the mammoth e-retailer Cloud, which has expanded in an environmentally ravaged near-future to dominate America’s economy and usurp its government....
description: A mammoth e-retailer in America’s near-future expands beyond shopping to solve mass shootings, reverse global warming, reduce unemployment and ultimately usurp the government.
